description:
The MYD11A1.005 dataset was decommissioned as of April 9, 2018. 

The MODIS/Aqua LST/E L3 Global 1 Km Grid (Short name: MYD11A1) products incorporate 1-km pixels, which are produced daily using the generalized split-window LST algorithm. This algorithm is optimally used to separate ranges of atmospheric column water vapor and lower boundary air surface temperatures into tractable sub-ranges. The surface emissivities in Bands 31 and 32 are estimated from land cover types.

MYD11A1 products are projected in a Sinusoidal grid by mapping the level-2 LST product (MYD11_L2) on 1-kilometer (precisely 0.928-km) grids. The MYD11A1 product comprises the following Science Data Set (SDS) layers for daytime and nighttime observations: LSTs, quality control assessments, observation times, view zenith angles, clear sky coverages, and Bands 31 and 32 emissivities from land cover types.

Aqua/MODIS V5  LST/E products, including MYD11A1, are validated to Stage-2 through field campaigns and radiance-based validation studies. Further details regarding MODIS land product validation for the LST/E products are available from the following URL: http://landval.gsfc.nasa.gov/ProductStatus.php?ProductID=MYD11

This product is ready for use in science applications/publications.
The V5 collection is not consistent with V4 and V41, and users should exercise caution as they plan to use the different collections.  Please refer to the LP DAAC MODIS product table at https://lpdaac.usgs.gov/products/modis_products_table/myd11a1  for additional detailed product version information.

V005 Data Set Characteristics: 
Area: ~1100 x 1100 km 
Image Dimensions: 1200 x 1200 rows/columns 
File Size: ~4 MB 
Resolution: ~1 kilometer (actual: 0.93km) 
Projection: Sinusoidal 
Data Format: HDF-EOS 
Science Data Sets (SDS HDF Layers): 12
Temporal Range: 2002-07-08 to 2017-03-31
title: MODIS/Aqua Land Surface Temperature/Emissivity Daily L3 Global 1km SIN Grid V005

usgs.title: Direct Download [1]
usgs.description: USGS EarthExplorer (EE) provides users the ability to query, search and order archived ASTER and MODIS products available from the LP DAAC.  Registered users of EE have access to additional features than guest users.
